channel.title: Beast computer build for just $600
channel.description:
[ul][list][list][list][list][list][list][list][list][list][list]Well, this time I've actually got $600 to spend on a computer...
[center][img]http://www.computerlx.com/ebay/getbigimage.ashx?image=ENTERPRISE.jpg[/img][/center]
This is what I've come up with: [list] [li]Processor -> [u]AMD FX-8320 3.5GHz BULLDOZER EIGHT CORE Processor[/u] (Cooling fan specs below)[/li] [list][li]For AMD Dual, Quad, Six, Eight core[/li] [li]CPU Support up to 3.8Ghz[/li] [li]Rated speed : 4600 rpm[/li] [li]Air flow : 25.9 CFM[/li] [li]Noise : 41 dBA[/li] [li]Rated voltage : 12 v[/li] [li]Heat sink material : Aluminum[/li][/list]
[li]Motherboard -> [u]GIGABYTE GA-78LMT-USB3 Socket AM3+/ AMD 760G/ DDR3/ USB3.0/ A&GbE/ MicroATX Motherboard[/u][/li] [list]Mfr Part Number: GA-78LMT-USB3[/li] [li]CPU: Socket AM3+[/li] [list]Supports AMD AM3+ Processor[/li] [li]Supports AMD AM3 Phenom II / AMD Athlon II Processor[/li][/list] [li]Chipset: North Bridge AMD 760G & South Bridge SB710[/li] [li]Memory: 4x 240pin DDR3-1333+(O.C.)/1066 DIMM Slots, Dual Channel, Max Capacity of 32GB[/li] [li]Slots: 1x PCI-Express 2.0 x16 Slot, 1x PCI-Express 2.0 x1 Slot, 1x PCI Slot[/li] [li]IDE/SATA: 1x IDE Connector (Supports ATA-133/ 100/ 66/ 33 and up to 2 IDE devices), 6x SATA2 Ports, Support RAID 0, 1, 10, JBOD[/li] [li]Audio: Realtek ALC887 7.1-Channel High Definition Audio CODEC, Support for S/PDIF Out[/li] [li]LAN: Realtek Gigabit Ethernet Controller[/li] [li]Ports: 8x USB 2.0/1.1 Ports (4 rear, 4 via headers), 4x USB 3.0/2.0 Ports (2 rear, 2 via header), 1x PS/2 Keyboard/Mouse Port, 1x Parallel Port (header), 1x VGA Port, 1x DVI-D Port, 1x HDMI Port, 1x RJ45 LAN Port, Audio I/O Jacks[/li] [li]Power Connector: 1x 24pin ATX Main Power Connector, 1x 8pin ATX 12V Power Connector[/li] [li]Form Factor: MicroATX, 24.4 x 24.4 cm[/li][/list]
[li]Memory -> [u]16GB -> 8GB (2 x 4GB) 240-Pin DDR3 1600MHz (PC3 12800) Dual Channel[/u][/li] [list] [li]8GB (2x4GB)[/li] [li]Dual Channel Kit[/li] [li]Speed 1600MHz[/li] [li]240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM[/li] [li]High Gaming performance[/li] [/list]
[li]Optical Drive -> [u]SEAGATE / WD 1TB 7200 RPM 64MB CACHE SATA 6.0Gb/s[/u][/li] [list] [li]Multy purpose drive[/li] [li]DVD and CD recorder[/li] [li]DVD recording speed 24x[/li] [li]CD recording speed 48x[/li] [li]Dual layer DVD R[/li] [/list]
[li]Case -> [u]ALLPCZONE ENTERPRISE MID-TOWER ATX CASE[/u][/li] [list] [li]10 drive bays[/li] [li]External 4 x 5.25", 1 x 3.5"[/li] [li]Internal 5 x 3.5" for HDD[/li] [li]2 x USB 2.0 - FRONT[/li] [li]4 x USB 2.0 - REAR[/li] [li]HD Audio In and Out[/li] [li]15.00" (D) x 7.1" (W) x 16.55"(H)[/li] [/list]
[li]Power Supply -> [u]THERMALTAKE 600 WATT[/u][/li] [list][li]Input:[/li][list] [li]Input Voltage: 115V / 230V[/li] [li]Input Current: 10A / 6A[/li] [li]Input Frequency Range: 47 ~ 63Hz[/li][/list] [li]Form Factor: Intel ATX 12V 2.3[/li] [li]Cooling System: 120mm Fan, 2000rpm ± 10%[/li] [li]PFC: Non PFC[/li] [li]Power Good Signal: 100 ~ 500 ms[/li] [li]Hold-up Time: 16 msec (minimum) @ 60% of full load at 115Vac/ 230Vac input[/li] [li]Output: +3.3V @ 22A; +5V @ 18A; +12V1 @ 23A; +12V2 @ 20A; +12V @ 0.3A; +5VSB @ 2.5A[/li] [li]Connector: 1x 20+4pin Main Connector; 1x 4+4pin 12V CPU Connector; 1x 6+2pin PCI-Express Connector; 1x 6pin PCI-Express Connector; 6x 5pin SATA Connectors; 4x 4pin Peripheral Connectors; 1x 4pin FDD Connector[/li] [li]Color: Black[/li] [li]Dimensions(WxLxH): 150.0 x 140.0 x 86.0 mm[/li][/list]
[li]Operating System -> [u]Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit[/u][/li]
[li]Storage -> SEAGATE / WD 1TB 7200 RPM 64MB CACHE SATA 6.0Gb/s[/li] [list] [li]Capacity: 1000 GB[/li] [li]Rotational Speed: 7200 rpm[/li] [li]Cache: 64 MB[/li] [li]Interface: SATA 600[/li] [li]Max. External Transfer Rate: 6 GB/s[/li] [/list] [li]Video -> [u]ATI HD 1GB DVI/VGA 1080p PCI-EXPRESS VIDEO[/u][/li] [list]Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce GT 740[/li] [li]Core Clock: 993 MHz[/li] [li]Video Memory: 2GB DDR3[/li] [li]Memory Clock: 1782 MHz[/li] [li]Memory Interface: 128-bit[/li] [li]Bus: PCI-Express 3.0 x16 (Compatible with 1.1)[/li] [li]CUDA Cores: 384[/li] [li]RAMDAC: 400MHz[/li] [li]Max Resolution: 2560 x 1600, Support 3x Display Monitors[/li] [li]Connectors: VGA, DVI Dual Link, HDMI[/li] [li]Thermal: Fansink[/li] [li]Dimensions (WxH): 5.700 x 4.376 inch / 144.78 x 111.15 mm[/li] [li]This Video Card Supports:[/li] [list][li]Microsoft Windows 8/ 7/ Vista (x86/x64)[/li] [li] Adaptive Vertical Sync Technology[/li] [li]NVIDIA SMX shader architecture[/li] [li]NVIDIA PhysX Technology[/li] [li]NVIDIA CUDA Technology[/li] [li]HDCP - High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection[/li] [li]Microsoft DirectX 12 and OpenGL 4.4[/li][/list][/list]
[li]Sound -> [u]REALTEK 6-CHANNEL DIGITAL SOUND[/u][/li] [list] [li]6-Channel nVidia SoundStorm APU[/li] [li]Dolby® Digital 5.1 real-time encoder[/li] [li]Compliant with AC97 2.2 specification[/li] [li]DirectX 8.1 Compatible[/li] [li]digital S/PDIF in[/li] [li]EAX2 and I3DL2 Reverb[/li] [li]Enhanced Sound Software and Utilities[/li] [/list]
[li]Network Card -> [u]REALTEK 10/100/1000 Gigabit Network Card[/u][/li] [list] [li]10/100/1000 Fast Ethernet Network Card (onboard)[/li] [li]Full Duplex Support[/li] [li]Broadband Internet ready![/li] [li]Certified for Windows 7, Windows 8[/li] [/list]
[b]Total Price:[/b] [u]638.00[/u]
Any thoughts? This will be my first computer and I don't want to make some mistakes.[/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/ul]

item.title: Beast computer build for just $600
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Lin:

Choose a few cards that fit your budget here and compare their benchmarks here. The chip on your motherboard only scores a 105, whereas a $30 card scores around the 350 range. I would recommend getting something at least in the 1000 range though, which aren’t that costly. But maybe you shouldn’t worry about it now, since that’s always something you can upgrade later. Something is better than nothing though.

Thanks a lot. I was taking a look at the nVidia GeForce cards and they are quite expensive, but people say it’s worth it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Choose a few cards that fit your budget here and compare their benchmarks here. The chip on your motherboard only scores a 105, whereas a $30 card scores around the 350 range. I would recommend getting something at least in the 1000 range though, which aren’t that costly. But maybe you shouldn’t worry about it now, since that’s always something you can upgrade later. item.title: Beast computer build for just $600
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Lin:

Either you’re not giving us any info on your video card, or what you listed is wrong. Newegg lists the video chip of that motherboard as an ATI Radeon 3000… You’re going to seriously be bottlenecking the rest of your hardware if you don’t get any sort of card. Even a $30 one will be significantly better.

Any suggestions on a video card?

Read full topic

item.title: Beast computer build for just $600
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Either you’re not giving us any info on your video card, or what you listed is wrong. Newegg lists the video chip of that motherboard as an ATI Radeon 3000… You’re going to seriously be bottlenecking the rest of your hardware if you don’t get any sort of card. Even a $30 one will be significantly better.

item.title: Beast computer build for just $600
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:549982”]Links to each item would be great instead of listing what they are, your on board video you’ve got there means nothing really without the tech specs.

Personally I’d never ever have another PC that doesn’t have an SSD, see if you can fit one into your budget.[/quote]
Oh yes, I will try to get you the specs for each item. Well, even though SSDs are supposedly faster, I don’t think it would matter to me. As long as it’s functioning and capable of my basic needs, I’m fine with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Beast computer build for just $600
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[ul][list][list][list][list][list][list][list][list][list][list]Well, this time I’ve actually got $600 to spend on a computer…

[center][/center]

This is what I’ve come up with:
[list]
[li]Processor -> AMD FX-8320 3.5GHz BULLDOZER EIGHT CORE Processor (Cooling fan specs below)[/li]
[list][li]For AMD Dual, Quad, Six, Eight core[/li]
[li]CPU Support up to 3.8Ghz[/li]
[li]Rated speed : 4600 rpm[/li]
[li]Air flow : 25.9 CFM[/li]
[li]Noise : 41 dBA[/li]
[li]Rated voltage : 12 v[/li]
[li]Heat sink material : Aluminum[/li][/list]

[li]Motherboard -> GIGABYTE GA-78LMT-USB3 Socket AM3+/ AMD 760G/ DDR3/ USB3.0/ A&GbE/ MicroATX Motherboard[/li]
[list]Mfr Part Number: GA-78LMT-USB3[/li]
[li]CPU: Socket AM3+[/li]
[list]Supports AMD AM3+ Processor[/li]
[li]Supports AMD AM3 Phenom II / AMD Athlon II Processor[/li][/list]
[li]Chipset: North Bridge AMD 760G & South Bridge SB710[/li]
[li]Memory: 4x 240pin DDR3-1333+(O.C.)/1066 DIMM Slots, Dual Channel, Max Capacity of 32GB[/li]
[li]Slots: 1x PCI-Express 2.0 x16 Slot, 1x PCI-Express 2.0 x1 Slot, 1x PCI Slot[/li]
[li]IDE/SATA: 1x IDE Connector (Supports ATA-133/ 100/ 66/ 33 and up to 2 IDE devices), 6x SATA2 Ports, Support RAID 0, 1, 10, JBOD[/li]
[li]Audio: Realtek ALC887 7.1-Channel High Definition Audio CODEC, Support for S/PDIF Out[/li]
[li]LAN: Realtek Gigabit Ethernet Controller[/li]
[li]Ports: 8x USB 2.0/1.1 Ports (4 rear, 4 via headers), 4x USB 3.0/2.0 Ports (2 rear, 2 via header), 1x PS/2 Keyboard/Mouse Port, 1x Parallel Port (header), 1x VGA Port, 1x DVI-D Port, 1x HDMI Port, 1x RJ45 LAN Port, Audio I/O Jacks[/li]
[li]Power Connector: 1x 24pin ATX Main Power Connector, 1x 8pin ATX 12V Power Connector[/li]
[li]Form Factor: MicroATX, 24.4 x 24.4 cm[/li][/list]

[li]Memory -> 16GB -> 8GB (2 x 4GB) 240-Pin DDR3 1600MHz (PC3 12800) Dual Channel[/li]
[list]
[li]8GB (2x4GB)[/li]
[li]Dual Channel Kit[/li]
[li]Speed 1600MHz[/li]
[li]240-Pin DDR3 SDRAM[/li]
[li]High Gaming performance[/li]
[/list]

[li]Optical Drive -> SEAGATE / WD 1TB 7200 RPM 64MB CACHE SATA 6.0Gb/s[/li]
[list]
[li]Multy purpose drive[/li]
[li]DVD and CD recorder[/li]
[li]DVD recording speed 24x[/li]
[li]CD recording speed 48x[/li]
[li]Dual layer DVD R[/li]
[/list]

[li]Case -> ALLPCZONE ENTERPRISE MID-TOWER ATX CASE[/li]
[list]
[li]10 drive bays[/li]
[li]External 4 x 5.25", 1 x 3.5"[/li]
[li]Internal 5 x 3.5" for HDD[/li]
[li]2 x USB 2.0 - FRONT[/li]
[li]4 x USB 2.0 - REAR[/li]
[li]HD Audio In and Out[/li]
[li]15.00" (D) x 7.1" (W) x 16.55"(H)[/li]
[/list]

[li]Power Supply -> THERMALTAKE 600 WATT[/li]
[list][li]Input:[/li][list]
[li]Input Voltage: 115V / 230V[/li]
[li]Input Current: 10A / 6A[/li]
[li]Input Frequency Range: 47 ~ 63Hz[/li][/list]
[li]Form Factor: Intel ATX 12V 2.3[/li]
[li]Cooling System: 120mm Fan, 2000rpm ± 10%[/li]
[li]PFC: Non PFC[/li]
[li]Power Good Signal: 100 ~ 500 ms[/li]
[li]Hold-up Time: 16 msec (minimum) @ 60% of full load at 115Vac/ 230Vac input[/li]
[li]Output: +3.3V @ 22A; +5V @ 18A; +12V1 @ 23A; +12V2 @ 20A; +12V @ 0.3A; +5VSB @ 2.5A[/li]
[li]Connector: 1x 20+4pin Main Connector; 1x 4+4pin 12V CPU Connector; 1x 6+2pin PCI-Express Connector; 1x 6pin PCI-Express Connector; 6x 5pin SATA Connectors; 4x 4pin Peripheral Connectors; 1x 4pin FDD Connector[/li]
[li]Color: Black[/li]
[li]Dimensions(WxLxH): 150.0 x 140.0 x 86.0 mm[/li][/list]

[li]Operating System -> Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit[/li]

[li]Storage -> SEAGATE / WD 1TB 7200 RPM 64MB CACHE SATA 6.0Gb/s[/li]
[list]
[li]Capacity: 1000 GB[/li]
[li]Rotational Speed: 7200 rpm[/li]
[li]Cache: 64 MB[/li]
[li]Interface: SATA 600[/li]
[li]Max. External Transfer Rate: 6 GB/s[/li]
[/list]
[li]Video -> ATI HD 1GB DVI/VGA 1080p PCI-EXPRESS VIDEO[/li]
[list]Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce GT 740[/li]
[li]Core Clock: 993 MHz[/li]
[li]Video Memory: 2GB DDR3[/li]
[li]Memory Clock: 1782 MHz[/li]
[li]Memory Interface: 128-bit[/li]
[li]Bus: PCI-Express 3.0 x16 (Compatible with 1.1)[/li]
[li]CUDA Cores: 384[/li]
[li]RAMDAC: 400MHz[/li]
[li]Max Resolution: 2560 x 1600, Support 3x Display Monitors[/li]
[li]Connectors: VGA, DVI Dual Link, HDMI[/li]
[li]Thermal: Fansink[/li]
[li]Dimensions (WxH): 5.700 x 4.376 inch / 144.78 x 111.15 mm[/li]
[li]This Video Card Supports:[/li]
[list][li]Microsoft Windows 8/ 7/ Vista (x86/x64)[/li]
[li] Adaptive Vertical Sync Technology[/li]
[li]NVIDIA SMX shader architecture[/li]
[li]NVIDIA PhysX Technology[/li]
[li]NVIDIA CUDA Technology[/li]
[li]HDCP - High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection[/li]
[li]Microsoft DirectX 12 and OpenGL 4.4[/li][/list][/list]

[li]Sound -> REALTEK 6-CHANNEL DIGITAL SOUND[/li]
[list]
[li]6-Channel nVidia SoundStorm APU[/li]
[li]Dolby® Digital 5.1 real-time encoder[/li]
[li]Compliant with AC97 2.2 specification[/li]
[li]DirectX 8.1 Compatible[/li]
[li]digital S/PDIF in[/li]
[li]EAX2 and I3DL2 Reverb[/li]
[li]Enhanced Sound Software and Utilities[/li]
[/list]

[li]Network Card -> REALTEK 10/100/1000 Gigabit Network Card[/li]
[list]
[li]10/100/1000 Fast Ethernet Network Card (onboard)[/li]
[li]Full Duplex Support[/li]
[li]Broadband Internet ready![/li]
[li]Certified for Windows 7, Windows 8[/li]
[/list]

Total Price: 638.00

Any thoughts? This will be my first computer and I don’t want to make some mistakes.[/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/list][/ul]
